Primary Contact: Larry Widmer, General Manager; Email: lwidmer@cfdcco.bc.ca
Service Details: - Provides financial assistance to Employment Insurance or Reachback eligible applicants who want to start their own business, or purchase an existing business in which they have had no prior ownership- Provides income support, business skills development workshops, one-on-one mentoring and counselling
Eligibility: - Individuals who are Employment Insurance or Reachback eligible, will require a referral from WorkBC to pursue the Self Employment Program, therefore you must contact WorkBC, meet with an Employment Counselor and attend an Self Employment Orientation Session- If suitable and eligible, following the Orientation Session at WorkBC, you will be referred to Community Futures to attend an 'Assess Your Business Idea Workshop'
How to Apply: - Please call to book an appointment to attend an Information Session outlining funding options, the Self Employment Program and Business Bootcamp requirements in detail- These Information Sessions explain the guidelines and benefits of the program and other support services available
Address & Map: 1726 Dolphin Ave, #210Kelowna, BC     V1Y 9R9View MapQuest Map
